FHIR-exanple-2 (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/example2)

Mapping from http://example.org/fhir/example1 to http://example.org/fhir/example2

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 13/06/2012 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir).

An example mapping


Source Concept Details Equivalence Destination Concept Details
Code from http://example.org/fhir/example1 Code from http://example.org/fhir/example3 Code from http://example.org/fhir/example2
code some-code equivalent code2

Specimen mapping from v2 table 0487 to SNOMED CT (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/102)

Mapping from http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v2-0487 to http://snomed.info/sct?fhir_vs

DRAFT. Published on 25/07/2013 by FHIR project team (original source: LabMCoP) ( http://hl7.org/fhir, http://www.phconnect.org/group...).


Source Concept Details Equivalence Destination Concept Details Comment
Code from v2 Specimen Type Code from SNOMED CT (all versions) Code from SNOMED CT (all versions) Code from SNOMED CT (all versions) Code from SNOMED CT (all versions)
ACNE (Tissue, Acne) equivalent 309068002 (Skin lesion sample)
ACNFLD (Fluid, Acne) equivalent 119323008 (Pus specimen) 47002008 (Pustule) HL7 term is a historical term. mapped to Pus
AIRS (Air Sample) equivalent 446302006 (Air sample)
ALL (Allograft) equivalent 119376003 (Tissue specimen) 7970006 (Allograft)
AMP (Amputation) equivalent 408654003 (Specimen obtained by amputation) 81723002 (Amputation)
ANGI (Catheter Tip, Angio) equivalent 119312009 (Catheter tip specimen) TBD in detail
ARTC (Catheter Tip, Arterial) equivalent 119312009 (Catheter tip specimen) TBD in detail
ASERU (Serum, Acute) unmatched pending
ASP (Aspirate) equivalent 119295008 (Specimen obtained by aspiration) 14766002 (Removal by suction)
ATTE (Environment, Attest) unmatched TBD
AUTOC (Environmental, Autoclave Capsule) unmatched TBD
AUTP (Autopsy) unmatched This really is not a specimen per se - it is the state of the subject from whom the specimen is collected, so it should be used as a specimen type modifier ONLY!. Often this is indicated with a special medical record number or other notation on the patient. needs to have specimen type (e.g. SPM-4) and source site (SPM.8) and spatial orientation (SPM.9)
BBL (Blood bag) equivalent 119304001 (Blood bag specimen)
BCYST (Cyst, Baker's) unmatched 32361000 (Popliteal fossa) submitted (PLR155) with parent of 167874004^knee joint synovial fluid (specimen), with specimen source topography 32361000^Popliteal fossa structure (body structure)
BITE (Bite) unmatched Submit for new term with parent 119365002

BON (Bone) equivalent 430268003 (Specimen from bone)
BOWL (Bowel contents) unmatched Don't use this term for human samples - use Stool instead. animal would use small intestinal contents, large intestinal contents
BPU (Blood product unit) equivalent 119300005 (Specimen from blood product)
BRN (Burn) equivalent 119367005 (Specimen from burn injury)
BRSH (Brush) equivalent 258415003 (Biopsy sample) 439336003 (Brush biopsy)

CSITE (Catheter Insertion Site) equivalent 258507003 (Swab of line insertion site) 285570007 (Taking of swab) 386144009 (Line insertion site) Prefer to have aspirate of the pus oozing out from cleaned insertion site - if swab is all that can be obtained, then swab after cleaning, otherwise you may get a contaminated specimen and a falsely identified infected central line. Do not just swab the reddened area - that will just collect skin flora

value.name: Specimen mapping from v2 table 0487 to SNOMED CT

target.comment: HL7 term is a historical term. mapped to Pus

This really is not a specimen per se - it is the state of the subject from whom the specimen is collected, so it should be used as a  specimen type modifier ONLY!. Often this is indicated with a special medical record number or other notation on the patient. needs to have specimen type (e.g. SPM-4) and source site (SPM.8) and spatial orientation (SPM.9)
submitted (PLR155) with parent of  167874004^knee joint synovial fluid (specimen), with specimen source topography 32361000^Popliteal fossa structure (body structure)
Submit for new term with parent 119365002
Don't use this term for human samples - use Stool instead. animal would use small intestinal contents, large intestinal contents
Submit for new term with parent 119365002
Be more specific use either: 119326000^hair specimen or 119327009^nail specimen
submit for new term with parent 119365002^Specimen from wound (specimen)

Prefer to have aspirate of the pus oozing out from cleaned insertion site - if swab is all that can be obtained, then swab after cleaning, otherwise you may get a contaminated specimen and a falsely identified infected central line. Do not just swab the reddened area - that will just collect skin flora
TBD - may use blood and SPM-6
Submit for new term with parent 119365002
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: not an acceptable specimen for micro - not specific enough term
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
this term is not specific enough, choose from terms that more accurately describe the specimen
Further describe the sample as tissue or pus. or by the collection method. The term boil is not specific to a body site - need to indicate source site (spm.8). preferred term is Aspirate_Boil
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Submit for new term with parent 119365002
Submit for new term with parent 119365002
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: stool is what is expected, should use stool sample
This describes a morphologic abnormality, not a sample
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: stool is what is expected, should use stool sample
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
should be more specific what kind of lesion is observed - be more specific is it a wound, abscess, mass - specify! Ask SNOMED CT to mark it as a grouper term only (309049000)
The HL7 term is a historical term Mapped to CSF obtained by lumbar puncture
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
be more precise use ulcer, tumor, vesicle
need to know what kind of lesion, so map to: UlcerTissue_penile, VesicleFluid_penile, Wound_penile, Mass tissue_penile, Necrotic tissue_penile, AbscessAspirate_penile, Anything else?
Historical term -though in this case more often used for discharge
Submit for new term with parent: 119365002
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: stool is what is expected, should use stool sample
Preferred is aspiration with sterile syringe from inflamed area. Specify body location of shunt site
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
This is the name of a lab test. A skin sample is examined for viral inclusions.
Bloodbanking term ONLY now map to blood and the respective preservative

Prefer to have aspirate of the pus oozing out from cleaned insertion site - if swab is all that can be obtained, then swab after cleaning, otherwise you may get a contaminated specimen and a falsely identified infected central line. Do not just swab the reddened area - that will just collect skin flora
Be more specific use either: 119326000^hair specimen, or 119327009^nail specimen

assume swab from shunt site for mapping here - clean surface of skin prior to expressing the shunt site - preferred is aspiration with sterile syringe should use SPM.8 to specify body approximate match location of shunt site

text.div:
FHIR-v3-Address-Use (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/101)

Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/address-use to http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-AddressUse

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 13/06/2012 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir). Creative Commons 0

A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems


Source Code Equivalence Destination Code Comment
home equivalent H (home address)
work equivalent WP (work place)
temp (Temporary) equivalent TMP (temporary address)
old (Old / Incorrect) disjoint BAD (bad address) In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

value.name: FHIR-v3-Address-Use
value.title: FHIR/v3 Address Use Mapping
value.description: A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems
value.purpose: To help implementers map from HL7 v3/CDA to FHIR

target.comment: In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A use context assigned to the concept map

parameters.name: context-quantity
parameters.description: A quantity- or range-valued use context assigned to the concept map

parameters.name: context-type
parameters.description: A type of use context assigned to the concept map

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The concept map publication date

parameters.name: dependson
parameters.description: Reference to property mapping depends on

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the concept map

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: External identifier for the concept map

parameters.name: jurisdiction
parameters.description: Intended jurisdiction for the concept map

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Computationally friendly name of the concept map

parameters.name: other
parameters.description: canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap to use for mapping if the source concept is unmapped

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: Reference to property mapping depends on

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Name of the publisher of the concept map

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source value set that contains the concepts that are being mapped

parameters.name: source-code
parameters.description: Identifies element being mapped

parameters.name: source-system
parameters.description: Source system where concepts to be mapped are defined

parameters.name: source-uri
parameters.description: The source value set that contains the concepts that are being mapped

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The current status of the concept map

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target value set which provides context for the mappings

parameters.name: target-code
parameters.description: Code that identifies the target element

parameters.name: target-system
parameters.description: Target system that the concepts are to be mapped to

parameters.name: target-uri
parameters.description: The target value set which provides context for the mappings

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The human-friendly name of the concept map

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The uri that identifies the concept map

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The business version of the concept map

info.description: A map from one set of concepts to one or more other concepts
info.title: FHIR R4 ConceptMap Resource

ConceptMap.description: A map from one set of concepts to one or more other concepts

contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

description.description: A free text natural language description of the concept map from a consumer's perspective.

experimental.description: For testing purposes, not real usage

identifier.description: Additional identifier for the concept map

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

jurisdiction.description: A legal or geographic region in which the concept map is intended to be used.

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

name.description: Name for this concept map (computer friendly)

publisher.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the concept map.

purpose.description: Explanation of why this concept map is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

source[x].description: The source value set that contains the concepts that are being mapped

status.description: The status of this concept map. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

target[x].description: The target value set which provides context for the mappings

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the concept map.

url.description: Canonical identifier for this concept map, represented as a URI (globally unique)

useContext.description: The context that the content is intended to support

version.description: Business version of the concept map

element.description: Mappings for a concept from the source set

source.description: Source system where concepts to be mapped are defined

sourceVersion.description: Specific version of the  code system

target.description: Target system that the concepts are to be mapped to

targetVersion.description: Specific version of the  code system

unmapped.description: What to do when there is no mapping for the source concept

target.description: Concept in target system for element

code.description: Code that identifies the target element

dependsOn.description: Other elements required for this mapping (from context)

equivalence.description: relatedto | equivalent | equal | wider | subsumes | narrower | specializes | inexact | unmatched | disjoint

product.description: Other concepts that this mapping also produces

display.description: Display for the code (if value is a code)

property.description: Reference to property mapping depends on

url.description: canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap to use for mapping if the source concept is unmapped

name.description: The name of an individual to contact.

telecom.description: The contact details for the individual (if a name was provided) or the organization.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

div.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

code.description: A code that identifies the type of context being specified by this usage context.
Symbol in syntax defined by the system

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
